text: Code organization in Python: Where is a good place to put obscure methods?
I have a class called Path for which there are defined about 10 methods, in a dedicated module Path.py.
Recently I had a need to write 5 more methods for Path, however these new methods are quite obscure and technical and 90% of the time they are irrelevant.
Where would be a good place to put them so their context is clear?
Of course I can just put them with the class definition, but I don't like that because I like to keep the important things separate from the obscure things.
Currently I have these methods as functions that are defined in a separate module, just to keep things separate, but it would be better to have them as bound methods.
(Currently they take the Path instance as an explicit parameter.
